abstract: Racing games, simplified word processors and stargazing assistants are among the applications capturing the eyes and clicks of iPad owners.
snippet: Racing games, simplified word processors and stargazing assistants are among the applications capturing the eyes and clicks of iPad owners.
lead_paragraph: Although it remains to be seen whether or not mainstream consumers will latch onto the iPad with the same ferocity as they did the iPhone, it’s clear that there’s no lack of appetite for apps. On Monday, Apple revealed that iPad owners were voraciously consuming applications. More than one million were downloaded before the weekend was over.

abstract: What, if anything, did Apple try to do to Daniel Lyons, Newsweek’s technology columnist?
snippet: What, if anything, did Apple try to do to Daniel Lyons, Newsweek’s technology columnist?
lead_paragraph: What, if anything, did Apple try to do to Daniel Lyons, Newsweek’s technology columnist?

headline.main: Update: The Continuing Mystery of a Newsweek Columnist vs. Apple
